entry.title: 43 Free Cloud Services for Application Developers
entry.content:
The folks at Xeround have compiled a pretty good list of 43 cloud computing services that can make life easier for application developers â€“ all free of charge. The list is organized by categories: cloud IDEs, source code management, issue tracking, cloud and open source databases, CMS, payment gateways, IaaS and PaaS, load testing, monitoring, knowledge base and web analytics.

They are missing some vendors however. Here's a list of some resources that Difio is using:

  • OpenShift - PaaS platform by Red Hat which is our primary resource;
  • dotCloud - another PaaS service;
  • Heroku - a popular PaaS vendor, especially among Ruby developers;
  • Twillio - cloud communications service.
  • HP Cloud - IaaS vendor that runs on KVM.

We're especially interested in what other PaaS platforms developers are using. Please let us know what is your programming language and platform in the comments!

entry.title: Difio Adds Support for Heroku
entry.content:
Today Difio is pleased to announce initial support for Heroku. Difio provides insight of available updates for open source components. It lets you inspect changes and take informed decision when or what to upgrade. This improves software life cycle planning and minimizes possible regressions and downtime.

We have added three new registration scripts allowing Heroku users to subscribe their applications to Difio. At the moment there is support for Python, Ruby and Node.js programming languages. Previously Heroku applications could be registered only manually but now this is automated and more convenient.

We encourage developers who use Heroku to register their applications and send us their feedback via GitHub or Twitter.
